meta.@content:
Camera, CameraShot and CameraMovement prototypes that demonstrate storyboard
capabilities and precise camera operation. This is a developmental effort for potential
X3D Specification improvement.
Schematron rules, backed up by initialize() checks
Camera nodes for Viewpoint navigation control

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo:
Camera node provides direct control of scene view to enable cinematic
camera animation shot by shot and move by move along with still digital-photography
settings for offline rendering of camera images.

field.@appinfo: Text description to be displayed for this Camera

Camera position in local transformation frame, which is default prior
to first CameraShot initialPosition getting activated

Camera rotation in local transformation frame, which is default prior
to first CameraShot initialPosition getting activated
pi/4
input fraction drives interpolators
input event binds or unbinds this Camera
output event indicates when this Camera is bound
output event indicates whether this Camera is bound or unbound
Vector distance to near clipping plane corresponds to NavigationInfo.avatarSize[0]
Vector distance to far clipping plane corresponds to NavigationInfo.visibilityLimit
Array of CameraShot nodes which in turn contain CameraMovement nodes
Whether camera headlight is on or off
Camera headlight color
Camera headlight intensity
Camera filter color that modifies virtual lens capture
Camera filter transparency that modifies virtual lens capture
upVector changes modify camera orientation (and possibly vice versa)

Focal length divided effective aperture diameter indicating width of focal
plane
Distance to focal plane of sharpest focus

Mark start/stop with true/false output respectively useful to trigger
external animations

Total duration of contained enabled CameraShot (and thus CameraMovement)
move durations
OfflineRender node
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo:
CameraShot collects a specific set of CameraMovement animations that make
up an individual shot.

field.@appinfo: Text description to be displayed for this CameraShot
Whether this CameraShot can be activated
Set of CameraMovement nodes
Setup to reinitialize camera position for this shot
Setup to reinitialize camera rotation for this shot

Setup to reinitialize aimpoint (relative location for camera direction)
for this shot
pi/4

Focal length divided effective aperture diameter indicating width of focal
plane
Distance to focal plane of sharpest focus
Subtotal duration of contained CameraMovement move durations

Mark start/stop with true/false output respectively useful to trigger
external animations
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo:
CameraMovement node defines a single camera movement animation including
goalPosition, goalOrientation, goalAimPoint and goalFieldOfView.

field.@appinfo: Text description to be displayed for this CameraMovement
Whether this CameraMovement can be activated
Duration in seconds for this move
Goal camera position for this move
Goal camera rotation for this move
Whether or not camera direction is tracking towards the aimPoint
Goal aimPoint for this move, ignored if tracking=false
Goal fieldOfView for this move

Focal length divided effective aperture diameter indicating width of focal
plane
Distance to focal plane of sharpest focus

Mark start/stop with true/false output respectively useful to trigger
external animations
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo:
OfflineRender defines a parameters for offline rendering of Camera animation
output to a movie file (or possibly a still shot).

field.@appinfo: Text description to be displayed for this OfflineRender
Whether this OfflineRender can be activated
Frames per second recorded for this rendering
Size of frame in number of pixels width and height
Relative dimensions of pixel height/width typically 1.33 or 1
Begin render operation
Progress performing render operation (0..1)
Render operation complete
Format of rendered output movie (mpeg mp4 etc.), use first supported format

Format of rendered output images (png jpeg gif tiff etc.) use first supported
format
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress
